26enum
27{
28 Id_Var, //1

30 Id_StringVar,
31 Id_Command,
32 Id_Alias, //5
33 Id_Local,
34 Id_Do,
35 Id_DoArgs,

43enum
44{
45 Idf_Persist = 1<<0,
46 Idf_Override = 1<<1,
47 Idf_Hex = 1<<2,
48 Idf_ReadOnly = 1<<3,
49 Idf_Overridden = 1<<4,
50 Idf_Unknown = 1<<5,
51 Idf_Arg = 1<<6,
52};
53
54struct ident;
55
56struct identval
57{
58 union
59 {
60 int i; // Id_Var, ValueInteger
61 float f; // Id_FloatVar, ValueFloat
62 char *s; // Id_StringVar, ValueString
63 const uint *code; // ValueCode
64 ident *id; // ValueIdent
65 const char *cstr; // ValueCString
66 };
67};
68
69struct tagval : identval
70{
71 int type;
72
73 void setint(int val);
74 void setfloat(float val);
75 void setnumber(double val);
76 void setstr(char *val);
77 void setnull();
78 void setcode(const uint *val);
79 void setmacro(const uint *val);
80 void setcstr(const char *val);
81 void setident(ident *val);
82
83 const char *getstr() const;
84 int getint() const;
85 float getfloat() const;
86 double getnumber() const;
87 bool getbool() const;
88 void getval(tagval &r) const;
89
90 void cleanup();
91};

93struct identstack
94{
95 identval val;
96 int valtype;
97 identstack *next;
98};

100typedef void (__cdecl *identfun)(ident *id);
101
110struct ident
111{
112 //this pointer will point to different types depending upon the type of variable
113 union identvalptr
114 {
115 void *p;
116 int *i;
117 float *f;
118 char **s;
119 };
120
121 uchar type;
122 union
123 {
124 uchar valtype;
125 uchar numargs;
126 };
127 ushort flags;
128 int index;
129 const char *name;
130 union
131 {
132 struct // Id_Var, Id_FloatVar, Id_StringVar
133 {
134 union //number var range union type
135 {
136 struct
137 {
138 int minval,
139 maxval;
140 }; // Id_Var
141 struct
142 {
143 float minvalf,
144 maxvalf;
145 }; // Id_FloatVar
146 };
147 identvalptr storage;
148 identval overrideval;
149 };
150 struct // Id_Alias
151 {
152 uint *code;
153 identval val;
154 identstack *stack;
155 };
156 struct // Id_Command
157 {
158 const char *args;
159 uint argmask;
160 };
161 };
162 identfun fun;
164 ident() {}
168 ident(int t, const char *n, int m, int x, int *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
169 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minval(m), maxval(x), fun((identfun)f)
170 { storage.i = s; }
171
175 ident(int t, const char *n, float m, float x, float *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
176 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minvalf(m), maxvalf(x), fun((identfun)f)
177 { storage.f = s; }
178
182 ident(int t, const char *n, char **s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
183 : type(t), flags(flags), name(n), fun((identfun)f)
184 { storage.s = s; }
185
186 // Id_Alias
187 ident(int t, const char *n, char *a, int flags)
188 : type(t), valtype(Value_String), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
189 { val.s = a; }
190
191 ident(int t, const char *n, int a, int flags)
192 : type(t), valtype(Value_Integer), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
193 { val.i = a; }
194
195 ident(int t, const char *n, float a, int flags)
196 : type(t), valtype(Value_Float), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
197 { val.f = a; }
198
199 ident(int t, const char *n, int flags)
200 : type(t), valtype(Value_Null), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
201 {}
202 ident(int t, const char *n, const tagval &v, int flags)
203 : type(t), valtype(v.type), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
204 { val = v; }
205
209 ident(int t, const char *n, const char *args, uint argmask, int numargs, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
210 : type(t), numargs(numargs), flags(flags), name(n), args(args), argmask(argmask), fun((identfun)f)
211 {}
212
213 void changed()
214 {
215 if(fun)
216 {
217 fun(this);
218 }
219 }
220
221 void setval(const tagval &v)
222 {
223 valtype = v.type;
224 val = v;
225 }
226
227 void setval(const identstack &v)
228 {
229 valtype = v.valtype;
230 val = v.val;
231 }
232
233 void forcenull()
234 {
235 if(valtype==Value_String)
236 {
237 delete[] val.s;
238 }
239 valtype = Value_Null;
240 }
241
242 float getfloat() const;
243 int getint() const;
244 double getnumber() const;
245 const char *getstr() const;
246 void getval(tagval &r) const;
247 void getcstr(tagval &v) const;
248 void getcval(tagval &v) const;
249};

303inline int parseint(const char *s)
304{
305 return static_cast<int>(strtoul(s, nullptr, 0));

484
485// nasty macros for registering script functions, abuses globals to avoid excessive infrastructure
486
487//* note: many of the VARF comments are very repetitive, because the code itself is nearly duplicated too *//
488
489/* how command registration works:
490 * In C++, all global variables must be initiated before main() is called
491 * Each of these macro kludges (which are placed at the global scope level) initializes some kind of global variable
492 * Because the macro kludges are the definition of global variables, at program initializiation, they must be run first
493 * The values of the variables themselves don't matter because they only exist to cheat and run before main()
494 * The macro kludges themselves register commands or values within some vector<>-s which keeps track of all cmds/vars
495 */
496
497//integer var macros
498//VAR_, _VARF, VARM_ are templates for "normal" macros that do not execute an inline function
499#define VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
500#define VARN(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, 0)
501#define VARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
502#define VARNR(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
503#define VAR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
504#define VARP(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
505#define VARR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
506
507//variable with inline function to be executed on change (VARiable with Function = VARF)
508#define VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
509 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
510
511#define VARFN(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, 0)
512#define VARF(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
513#define VARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
514#define VARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
515#define VARFNP(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
516
517//hexadecimal var macros
518#define HVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist | Idf_Hex)
519#define HVARP(name, min, cur, max) HVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
520
521//hex variable with function to be executed on change (Hexadecimal VARiable with Function = HVARF)
522//the CVAR series of macros borrows the HVARF macro as it deals with hex colors
523#define HVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
524 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist | Idf_Hex); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
525
526//color var macros
527#define CVAR_(name, cur, init, body, persist) bvec name = bvec::hexcolor(cur); HVARF_(name, _##name, 0, cur, 0xFFFFFF, { init; name = bvec::hexcolor(_##name); body; }, persist)
528#define CVARP(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Persist)
529#define CVARR(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Override)
530#define CVARFP(name, cur, body) CVAR_(name, cur, , body, Idf_Persist)
531#define CVAR0_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(!_##name) _##name = cur; }, body, persist)
532#define CVAR0R(name, cur) CVAR0_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
533#define CVAR1_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(_##name <= 255) _##name |= (_##name<<8) | (_##name<<16); }, body, persist)
534#define CVAR1R(name, cur) CVAR1_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
535#define CVAR1FR(name, cur, body) CVAR1_(name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
536
537//float var macros
538#define FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
539#define FVARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
540#define FVAR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
541#define FVARP(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
542#define FVARR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
543
544//float variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
545#define FVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
546 float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */ \
547
548#define FVARF(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
549#define FVARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
550#define FVARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
551
552//string var macros
553#define SVAR_(name, global, cur, persist) char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, nullptr, persist)
554#define SVAR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, 0)
555#define SVARP(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Persist)
556#define SVARR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Override)
557
558//string variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
559#define SVARF_(name, global, cur, body, persist) \
560 char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
561
562#define SVARF(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, 0)
563#define SVARFR(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
564
565#endif /* COMMAND_H_ */
